text: English grammar lesson 23 topic the
definite article for generic nouns you
may know that I played the accordion in
the piano I have an electronic keyboard
it's not a real piano but for me it's
just as good now in this house we also
have a ukulele but the funny thing is
nobody and my family plays the ukulele
mmm least of all me you just heard three
examples of generic nouns I play the
piano I play the accordion I don't play
the ukulele so what is a generic noun
we'll consider just the one sentence I
play the piano am i talking about a
specific piano no is there any
particular piano I can't play no so a
generic noun is not a specific noun
we're not talking about any particular
person or thing instead we're talking
about any and all members of a category
or of a group I play the piano means I
play any and all pianos it may seem
confusing that both the definite and
indefinite article can be used to make
general statements about musical
instruments but let me show you one
difference to express piano as a
category of instruments we can use the
definite article as an I play the piano
to express piano as one physical object
especially during a first mention will
usually need the indefinite article as
in I don't own a piano it means I don't
own one one of those instruments
there have been many great inventions
for the home especially for the kitchen
think about it the oven the microwave
the toaster oven the dishwasher is a
wonderful invention I think but probably
the most significant invention for the
home and for the kitchen is the
refrigerator
let's talk about the difference between
the refrigerator and our refrigerator
because both articles can be used to
make general references to inventions
the refrigerator is an invention so to
talk about refrigerator as a category of
inventions a group of kitchen appliances
we can use the definite article as in
the refrigerator is the most significant
invention for the home we're talking
about any and all refrigerators to talk
about refrigerator as one physical
object especially during a first mention
will usually need the indefinite article
as in why do they build such a small
kitchen there's no room for a
refrigerator I'm saying there's no room
for one there's no room for one of those
appliances if I switched ah to the in
that sentence then I would be talking
about a specific refrigerator which
would be understood by the speaker and
all listeners specific from context
for my son's fifth birthday my husband
and I decided to buy him five tropical
community fish that means these fish are
not aggressive what we didn't know
unfortunately is that the black male
this all-black one is a very sensitive
fish the black male actually prefers
twenty or thirty gallon aquariums
to talk about black male as a class of
fish a type of fish we can use the
definite article as in the black male is
a sensitive fish I'm not talking about
one fish in particular I'm talking about
a characteristic that all black mollies
have now if I do want to talk about
black male as one fish I'll likely need
the indefinite article we bought a black
male without knowing it would need a big
aquarium we bought one we bought one of
those kind one member of that class let
me make an important note so far I've
shown that for musical instruments
inventions and animals we can create
generic nouns by using the plus a
singular count noun we do have a second
choice we can use the zero article plus
a plural count noun the two sentences
that you see here have the same meaning
the black male is a sensitive fish black
mollies are sensitive fish the
difference is informality the first
sentence sounds more formal it's what
you would read or hear in scientific or
academic context the second is more
common in everyday speech these patterns
are generally true of animals inventions
and musical instruments now let's
compare not two but three patterns the
piano is a percussion instrument with 88
keys pianos are percussion instruments
with 88 keys these are the same patterns
we just looked at we have the definite
article plus a singular noun the zero
article plus a plural noun but don't
forget what you learned in lesson 22 we
can make a general statement by using
the indefinite article and a singular
noun as in a piano is a percussion
instrument with 88 keys this law
sentence to my ears sounds most like a
dictionary definition now remember I'm
teaching you
but earns guidelines not fixed rules
that can't be broken because we'll
always find exceptions for example I
play the piano when we talk about
playing musical instruments we can only
use the the other two structures aren't
possible
if there's one thing I want you to take
away from this lesson it's the
understanding that we can make a generic
noun by using the definite article and a
singular count noun when we're talking
about these three things musical
instruments inventions and animals
exercise one test your understanding
choose the appropriate article or
articles then watch the video to hear
the correct choice example this is
called a the ukulele which article is
correct we're identifying a musical
instrument to identify we usually use
the indefinite article let's confirm by
watching
remember this is called a ukulele was
our answer choice correct yes this is
called a ukulele number one
now watch the video
can I play the ukulele no I can't play
the ukulele I have a ukulele but I can't
play the ukulele look at the answers
once again number two
you
now watch the video
not all the places I lived in in the
past had a dishwasher so I know it's
okay to live with that one but now that
I've been living in a home with the
dishwasher for several years I can say
that the dishwasher is a very good and
useful invention especially for a family
look at the answers once again
number three
you
now watch the video my son wanted a
hamster at first then I did some reading
I learned that hamsters are active at
night and rest during the day they can
also bite and escape their cages so I
convinced my son that fish make good
pets look at the answers once again
exercise to give your opinion answer the
questions explain your answers if you're
working with a partner take turns asking
the questions if you're studying alone
write down your answers 1 what is the
most significant invention the telephone
the car or the computer
to which animals do humans hunt the most
whales deer or ducks
three which instrument is the most
difficult to play the drums the flute or
the harp
